column4: can you try holding shift at boot and select recover boot or single user boot?
....... i tried the recover mode but it also gives init not found error
I guess your boot media must have mest up.  try boot a livecd and try mount the root partition to see if it's intact

.. the boot CD also fails actually .......  it kind of freezes midway ... also tried the safe graphics mode while booting from CD still fails ......... as long as i am using the GFX card none of linux distro (tried fedora Kubuntu ubuntu)  fail to boot
